text: In Greek mythology, Hippodamia, Hippodamea or Hippodameia (; Ancient Greek: Ἱπποδάμεια, "she who masters horses" derived from hippos "horse" and damazein "to tame") may refer to these female characters: *Hippodamia, daughter of Oenomaus and wife of Pelops.Pausanias, Description of Greece, 6. 21. 9–11, with a reference to Megalai Ehoiai fr. 259(a). * Hippodameia, a.k.a. Briseis, the wife of a prince in Asia Minor at the time of the Trojan War * Hippodameia, wife of Alcathous (the son of Aesyetes) and daughter of Anchises.Scholia on Iliad, 13. 429Hesychius of Alexandria s. v *Hippodamia (wife of Pirithous), daughter of Atrax or Butes.Diodorus Siculus, Library of History, 4. 70. 3 *Hippodamia (wife of Autonous), mother of Anthus. * Hippodamia, name shared by two of the Danaïdes, daughters of King Danaus of Libya either by the hamadryads, Atlanteia or Phoebe. One of them married and killed her husband Istrus and the other Diocorystes.Pseudo-Apollodorus. Bibliotheca, Book 2.1.5 These princes were sons of King Aegyptus of Egypt and an Arabian woman. Either of these two Hippodamia became the mother of Olenus by Zeus.Clementine Recognitions 10.21. *Hippodamia, daughter of Anicetus who consorted with Zeus.Clementine Recognitions 10.21. * Hippodamia, possible name for the mother of Guneus by Ocytus.Tzetzes, Homeric Allegories, Prologue, 629 - 630 * Hippodamia, an Athenian maiden who was one of the would-be sacrificial victims of Minotaur.Painting on François Vase; CIG 4. 8185 *Hippodamia, also known as LaodamiaHomer, Iliad, 6. 197-205 or Deidamia,Diodorus Siculus, Library of History, 5. 79. 3 daughter of the hero Bellerophon and Philonoe, daughter of the Lycian king Iobates. She was said to mothered Sarpedon by the god Zeus.Clementine Recognitions 10.21. == References == Category:Women in Greek mythology
title: Hippodamia (mythology)
